sentences.english: If I have to stay late at work tonight, it won’t matter because we can go out another night.
sentences.chinese: 如果今晚我必须工作到很晚的话，那也没关系，我们可以改天晚上再出去。

sentences.english: Does it matter what I think?
sentences.chinese: 我怎么想重要吗？

sentences.english: Do you think it matters that the cups and saucers don’t match?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得茶杯与杯托不相配要紧吗？

sentences.english: campaigning on issues that really matter
sentences.chinese: 以重大问题为竞选议题

sentences.english: Money was the only thing that mattered to him.
sentences.chinese: 对他来说，钱是唯一重要的东西。

sentences.english: I don’t care what it looks like – what matters is that it works.
sentences.chinese: 我不在乎外观——要紧的是它要管用。

sentences.english: At last she was with the man she loved and nothing else mattered .
sentences.chinese: 最终她和她所爱的男人在一起了，其他都无关紧要。

sentences.english: She said very little during the meal. Not that it mattered (= it was not important ) .
sentences.chinese: 她吃饭时话很少，那倒无所谓。

detailed_translations.english: to be important, especially to be important to you, or to have an effect on what happens

sentences.english: I had a sore throat and aching limbs.
sentences.chinese: 我喉咙疼，四肢酸痛。

sentences.english: Mac’s still sore because I didn’t invite him.
sentences.chinese: 马克还在因为我没邀请他而生气呢。

sentences.english: They were starving and covered with sores.
sentences.chinese: 他们在挨饿，身上长满了疮。

detailed_translations.english: a part of your body that is sore is painful, because of infection or because you have used a muscle too much
a painful, often red, place on your body caused by a wound or infection

sentences.english: A lot of people think that drinking milk while you have a cold is a bad idea because it causes more mucous to build up.
sentences.chinese: 许多人认为感冒了喝牛奶是不对的，因为这样会在你口腔内积聚更多粘稠液。

sentences.english: I was so hungry my stomach hurt.
sentences.chinese: 我饿得胃都痛了。

sentences.english: His stomach was full of food.
sentences.chinese: 他的胃里塞满了食物。

detailed_translations.english: the organ inside your body where food begins to be  digested
to be able to accept something, especially something unpleasant

sentences.english: Father doctored me for ordinary stomachache.
sentences.chinese: 父亲为我治疗一般的胃痛。

sentences.english: A fever can also affect sleep and dreams, as can a stomachache, which is why some people believe spicy foods or eating right before bed causes wild dreams.
sentences.chinese: 发烧也能影响睡眠和做梦，胃痛也如此，这就是为什么有人相信睡前吃了辛辣的食物会做噩梦。

detailed_translations.english: pain in your stomach or near your stomach

sentences.english: It is a nice kettle of fish! I have a stomachache.
sentences.chinese: 这是一锅好鱼，（可惜）我胃痛。

sentences.english: I have a stomachache because I ate a green peach yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 我胃疼，因为我昨天吃了未熟的桃子。

sentences.english: My foot hurts.
sentences.chinese: 我脚痛。

sentences.english: I had blisters on the soles of my feet .
sentences.chinese: 我的脚底起泡了。

sentences.english: I dropped a glass earlier, so don’t walk around in bare feet .
sentences.chinese: 我刚才打破了一个玻璃杯，所以不要光着脚到处走。

sentences.english: The vet examined the horse’s hind feet .
sentences.chinese: 兽医检查了马的后蹄。

sentences.english: He walked to the foot of the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他走到楼梯下面。

sentences.english: He’s six feet tall , with blonde hair.
sentences.chinese: 他身高六英尺，一头金发。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body that you stand on and walk on

sentences.english: Mike rubbed the back of his neck.
sentences.chinese: 迈克揉了揉后颈。

sentences.english: You have a lot of tension in your neck muscles.
sentences.chinese: 你的颈部肌肉很紧张。

sentences.english: He patted his horse’s neck.
sentences.chinese: 他拍了拍马脖子。

sentences.english: She had a mass of golden hair, which she wore in a coil at the nape  of her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她有一头金发，盘在脖子后面。

sentences.english: The dog picked up the puppy and carried it by the scruff of the neck into the house.
sentences.chinese: 那条狗叼住小狗的后颈，把它叼进了屋子。

detailed_translations.english: the part of your body that joins your head to your shoulders, or the same part of an animal or bird

sentences.english: The singer complained of a sore throat after Wednesday’s show.
sentences.chinese: 星期三演出后，这位歌手说喉咙痛。

detailed_translations.english: the passage from the back of your mouth to the top of the tubes that go down to your lungs and stomach

sentences.english: Andy has a fever and won’t be coming into work today.
sentences.chinese: 安迪发烧了，今天不来上班。

sentences.english: I woke up this morning with a fever and an upset stomach.
sentences.chinese: 今天早上醒来时我发烧了，胃也不舒服。

sentences.english: She’s running a fever (= has a fever ) .
sentences.chinese: 她在发烧。

detailed_translations.english: an illness or a medical condition in which you have a very high temperature

detailed_translations.chinese: 使发烧；使狂热；使患热病

sentences.english: to lie on your back/side/front
sentences.chinese: 仰 / 侧 / 俯卧

sentences.english: The book lay open on his desk.
sentences.chinese: 那本书摊开放在他的书桌上。

sentences.english: The town lies in a small wooded valley.
sentences.chinese: 该城镇坐落于一个林木茂盛的山谷中。

detailed_translations.english: to be or put yourself in a flat or horizontal position so that you are not standing or sitting

sentences.english: Why don't you go upstairs and lie down for a bit?
sentences.chinese: 你为什么不上楼躺一会儿？

detailed_translations.english: When you lie down, you move into a horizontal position, usually in order to rest or sleep

name: rest
trans: 放松，休息；剩余部分，其余

sentences.english: If you’re tired, we’ll stop and rest for a while.
sentences.chinese: 如果你累了，我们就停下来歇一会儿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使休息，使轻松；把…寄托于
detailed_translations.english: to stop working or doing an activity for a time and sit down or lie down to relax

detailed_translations.chinese: 休息，静止；休息时间；剩余部分；支架
detailed_translations.english: a period of time when you are not doing anything tiring and you can relax or sleep

sentences.english: Matthew coughed and cleared his throat.
sentences.chinese: 马修咳了一声清清喉咙。

sentences.english: I think I’m getting a cold or flu – I’ve been coughing and sneezing all day.
sentences.chinese: 我想我是着凉了，或者得了流感——我整天都在咳嗽和打喷嚏。

sentences.english: He’s got a bad cough.
sentences.chinese: 他咳嗽得很厉害。

detailed_translations.english: to suddenly push air out of your throat with a short sound, often repeatedly
a medical condition that makes you cough a lot

sentences.english: The X-ray showed that her leg was not broken.
sentences.chinese: X光片显示她的腿没有骨折。

detailed_translations.english: a beam of radiation1 that can go through solid objects and is used for photographing the inside of the body
to photograph the inside of someone’s body using X-rays

sentences.english: I’ve got toothache .
sentences.chinese: 我牙痛。

sentences.english: I had terrible toothache all last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚我一整夜牙疼得厉害。

detailed_translations.english: a pain in a tooth

sentences.english: If you have a headache, you should take some aspirin.
sentences.chinese: 要是头痛，你该吃点阿司匹林。

sentences.english: The airline's biggest headache is the increase in the price of aviation fuel.
sentences.chinese: 令航空公司最头疼的问题是航空燃料价格的上涨。

detailed_translations.english: a pain in your head

sentences.english: When people become newly infected with HIV, they often have a fever and minor illness at the time but rarely know what it is.
sentences.chinese: 当人们受艾滋病病毒重新感染时，他们常常同时有发烧和轻微不适，但很少知道它是什么。

sentences.english: Now they know how to fight it – by sleeping under insecticide-treated nets and seeking medical care at the dispensary when they have a fever.
sentences.chinese: 现在他们知道如何与该病作斗争 — 通过在经杀虫剂处理的蚊帐里睡觉和在发烧时到诊所寻求医疗。

sentences.english: I had to break a window to get into the house.
sentences.chinese: 我只得打破一扇窗户进屋。

detailed_translations.english: if you break something, you make it separate into two or more pieces, for example by hitting it, dropping it, or bending it

sentences.english: Was anyone hurt in the accident?
sentences.chinese: 事故中有人受伤吗？

sentences.english: Put that thing down - you might hurt someone with it.
sentences.chinese: 快把那东西放下，你会伤着别人的。

sentences.english: I didn’t mean to hurt your feelings.
sentences.chinese: 我不是故意要伤害你的感情。

detailed_translations.english: to injure yourself or someone else

sentences.english: Neither the driver nor the passengers were hurt.
sentences.chinese: 司机和乘客均未受伤。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is travelling in a vehicle, plane, boat etc, but is not driving it or working on it

sentences.english: He got into his car and drove off.
sentences.chinese: 他上了车，随即开车走了。

sentences.english: Will someone switch the radio off?
sentences.chinese: 谁把收音机关掉好吗？

detailed_translations.english: away from a place

sentences.english: That roof is dangerous, do get off.
sentences.chinese: 那房顶太危险，千万要下来。

sentences.english: Excuse me, I have to get off at the next stop.
sentences.chinese: 劳驾，我必须在下一站下车。

sentences.english: Democracy would take us where we wanted to go, not our own effort.Sometimes you have to get off and push.
sentences.chinese: 民主会把我们带到我们想去的地方，但光靠我们的努力还不行，有时候要下车推一推。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下（飞机、火车、公共汽车等）

sentences.english: She watched him walk onto the platform.
sentences.chinese: 她看着他走上站台。

sentences.english: Don’t jump onto (= into ) the bus while it’s moving.
sentences.chinese: 别在公共汽车开动时跳上车。

sentences.english: Pour the syrup on to the egg mixture.
sentences.chinese: 把糖浆倒进鸡蛋混合料中。

sentences.english: The car rolled over onto its side.
sentences.chinese: 这辆汽车侧翻过来了。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that someone or something moves to a position on a surface, area, or object

sentences.english: Recent stock market losses point to trouble ahead.
sentences.chinese: 最近股市的下跌预示着未来将有麻烦。

detailed_translations.english: problems or difficulties
to say something or ask someone to do something which may use or waste their time or upset them

sentences.english: Which band had a hit with ‘Bohemian Rhapsody’?
sentences.chinese: 《波希米亚狂想曲》是哪支乐队风行一时的歌曲？

detailed_translations.english: something such as a film, play, song etc that is very popular and successful

sentences.english: If he looked away, I could find the answer right away.
sentences.chinese: 只要他的眼睛往窗外看一看，我就立刻能找到答案。

sentences.english: But for critical messages, where administrators need the information right away, these messages can be sent immediately to the console.
sentences.chinese: 但是，对于重要消息，如果管理员立刻需要相关信息，则可以立即将这些消息发送到控制台。

detailed_translations.english: immediately; without delay

sentences.english: He was eager to get into politics.
sentences.chinese: 他渴望从政。

sentences.english: It's easier to get into debt than to get out of it again!
sentences.chinese: 负债容易还债难!

detailed_translations.english: become involved in something

name: herself
trans: 她自己，她本身（she的反身代词）

sentences.english: She hurt herself.
sentences.chinese: 她弄伤了自己。

sentences.english: She must be very proud of herself.
sentences.chinese: 她一定非常自豪。

detailed_translations.english: used when the woman or girl who performs an action is also affected by it

sentences.english: We put some ointment and a bandage on his knee.
sentences.chinese: 我们在他的膝盖上涂了些药膏，还缠了一条绷带。

sentences.english: The nurse bandaged up his sprained ankle.
sentences.chinese: 护士用绷带包扎他扭伤的脚踝。

detailed_translations.english: a narrow piece of cloth that you tie around a wound or around a part of the body that has been injured
to tie or cover a part of the body with a bandage

sentences.english: His mother’s very sick.
sentences.chinese: 他母亲病得很重。

sentences.english: Maria can’t come in today because she’s sick.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚因为生病今天不能来了。

sentences.english: a sick child
sentences.chinese: 生病的孩子

sentences.english: a sick animal
sentences.chinese: 患病的动物

sentences.english: What will happen to the business if you fall sick (= become ill ) or die?
sentences.chinese: 假如你生病或是去世了，公司怎么办？

sentences.english: He took sick (= became ill ) and died a week later.
sentences.chinese: 他病倒后一周就去世了。

sentences.english: Pete’s at home in bed, sick as a dog (= very sick ) .
sentences.chinese: 皮特卧床在家，病得很重。

detailed_translations.chinese: 厌恶的；病态的；不舒服；渴望的；恶心的 ；生病的
detailed_translations.english: suffering from a disease or illness
people who are ill

sentences.english: Lucy had a bandage round her knee.
sentences.chinese: 露西的膝盖上缠着绷带。

sentences.english: a knee injury
sentences.chinese: 膝伤

detailed_translations.english: the joint that bends in the middle of your leg
to hit someone with your knee

sentences.english: Whenever I have a cold I get a nosebleed.
sentences.chinese: 每次我一感冒都会流鼻血。

detailed_translations.english: if you have a nosebleed, blood starts flowing from your nose

sentences.english: The room filled with smoke, and it was becoming difficult to breathe.
sentences.chinese: 房间里全是烟，呼吸越来越困难。

sentences.english: People are concerned about the quality of the air they breathe.
sentences.chinese: 人们关心他们所呼吸的空气的质量。

sentences.english: Relax and breathe deeply (=  take in a lot of air  ) .
sentences.chinese: 放松，深呼吸。

detailed_translations.english: to take air into your lungs and send it out again
to take air into your lungs and send it out again

sentences.english: A badly sunburned face or back is extremely painful.
sentences.chinese: 严重晒伤了的脸或背部是非常疼痛的。

detailed_translations.english: having a red and painful skin as a result of spending too much time in the sun

sentences.english: We prepared ourselves for the long journey ahead.
sentences.chinese: 我们为将要开始的长途旅行做好了准备。

sentences.english: It was strange seeing ourselves on television.
sentences.chinese: 在电视上看到自己感觉很奇怪。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking to show that they and one or more other people are affected by their own action

sentences.english: a mountain climber
sentences.chinese: 登山运动员

detailed_translations.english: someone who climbs as a sport or a hobby

sentences.english: Skiers always face the risk of serious injury.
sentences.chinese: 滑雪者始终面临着受重伤的风险。

sentences.english: It was a risk, sending a letter to my house.
sentences.chinese: 将信寄到我家是冒险。

detailed_translations.english: the possibility that something bad, unpleasant, or dangerous may happen

sentences.english: That's why a lot of us like the idea of living on the edge: It's in our DNA to take risks.
sentences.chinese: 这就是为什么我们许多人有喜欢过惊险刺激的生活这种想法：冒险就在人的DNA中。

sentences.english: Teachers can help them learn to take risks in an atmosphere where they feel confident about doing so.
sentences.chinese: 教师可以帮助他们在一定的环境中冒险，使她们因为这么做而感到自信。

name: accident
trans: 意外事件；事故；交通事故；车祸；失事

sentences.english: Ken had an accident at work and had to go to hospital.
sentences.chinese: 肯在工作中出了事故，不得不去医院。

sentences.english: I had a slight accident with your coffee.
sentences.chinese: 出了个小小的意外，我把你的咖啡弄洒了。

sentences.english: a train accident
sentences.chinese: 火车事故

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which someone is injured or something is damaged without anyone intending them to be

sentences.english: The house is in a charming situation, on a wooded hillside.
sentences.chinese: 房子位于林木茂密的小山坡上，环境十分优美。

detailed_translations.english: the type of area where a building is situated - used especially by people who sell or advertise buildings

sentences.english: Sugar was rationed to 1 kg. per family.
sentences.chinese: 每户供应一公斤白糖。

sentences.english: To effectively combat such malnutrition and under-nourishment, 20 g of animal protein per person per day or 7.3 kg per year should be provided.
sentences.chinese: 为了有效地战胜这类营养不良和营养不足，每人每天需要20克的动物蛋白或每年7.3公斤动物蛋白。

detailed_translations.english: a written abbreviation for kilograms

sentences.english: She covered her face, rocking to and fro in her grief.
sentences.chinese: 她捂住脸，悲痛得身体不住地来回晃动。

sentences.english: The waves rocked the boat from side to side .
sentences.chinese: 波浪使小船左摇右晃。

sentences.english: Paul sat gently rocking the child in his arms.
sentences.chinese: 保罗坐着，轻轻摇晃怀里的孩子。

sentences.english: Jim rocked with laughter when he heard what had happened.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆听了发生的事情后笑得前仰后合。

detailed_translations.english: to move gently backwards and forwards or from side to side, or to make something do this
a type of popular modern music with a strong loud beat, played using  guitar s  and drums

sentences.english: We're running out of time.
sentences.chinese: 我们没时间了。

detailed_translations.english: use up one's supply of something or something be used up

sentences.english: a knife and fork
sentences.chinese: 一副刀叉

sentences.english: Some young people are carrying knives to defend themselves.
sentences.chinese: 一些年轻人带着刀子防身。

sentences.english: a kitchen knife
sentences.chinese: 厨房用刀

sentences.english: Use a sharp knife to cut the melon into sections.
sentences.chinese: 用快刀把瓜切成块。

detailed_translations.english: a metal blade fixed into a handle, used for cutting or as a weapon
to put a knife into someone’s body

sentences.english: Mrs. Johnson cut off a generous piece of the meat.
sentences.chinese: 约翰逊太太切下一大块肉。

sentences.english: He threatened to cut my hair off.
sentences.chinese: 他威胁要剪掉我的头发。

detailed_translations.english: If you cut something off, you remove it with a knife or a similar tool

sentences.english: Her body was found in a pool of blood.
sentences.chinese: 她的尸体被发现倒在血泊之中。

sentences.english: Blood oozed from a cut on his forehead.
sentences.chinese: 血从他额头的伤口里渗了出来。

sentences.english: There’s Irish blood on his mother’s side.
sentences.chinese: 他母亲有爱尔兰血统。

detailed_translations.english: the red liquid that your heart pumps around your body

sentences.english: The red light means ‘Stop’.
sentences.chinese: 红灯表示“停”。

sentences.english: This light means you’re running low on fuel.
sentences.chinese: 这个灯亮说明汽油不多了。

detailed_translations.english: to have or represent a particular meaning

sentences.english: The door locked accidentally, and I couldn't get out of the room.
sentences.chinese: 门无意中反锁上了，我无法从房间里出来了。

sentences.english: He was full of his own importance (= he behaved in an annoying way which showed that he thought he was very important ).
sentences.chinese: 他自以为很了不起。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being important

sentences.english: Do you ever wonder if you made the right decision?
sentences.chinese: 你怀疑过自己所作的决定是否正确吗？

sentences.english: The judges’ decision is final (= it will not be changed ).
sentences.chinese: 法官的裁决是最终判决。

sentences.english: the ability to act with speed and decision
sentences.chinese: 处事迅速果断的能力

detailed_translations.english: a choice or judgment that you make after a period of discussion or thought

sentences.english: Police had to be called in to control the crowds.
sentences.chinese: 只好调来警察控制人群。

sentences.english: He controlled the urge to laugh.
sentences.chinese: 他克制住笑的冲动。

sentences.english: The disease robs you of muscle control.
sentences.chinese: 这种疾病会让你丧失肌肉控制力。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone or something do what you want, or make something happen in the way that you want
the ability or power to make someone or something do what you want or make something happen in the way you want

sentences.english: His spirits were so low (= he was so sad ) that he refused to answer his phone.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪非常低落，连电话也不愿接。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神；心灵；情绪；志气；烈酒
detailed_translations.english: the qualities that make someone live the way they do, and make them different from other people

sentences.english: 1.5 million people are in immediate danger of death from starvation.
sentences.chinese: 150万人正因饥饿而即将面临死亡的危险。

detailed_translations.english: a creature that looks like a human  skeleton  , used in paintings, stories etc to represent the fact that people die

sentences.english: The Coast Guard had given up all hope of finding the two divers alive.
sentences.chinese: 海岸警卫队已放弃了两名潜水员生还的全部希望。

detailed_translations.english: If you give up something, you stop doing it or having it

sentences.english: The nurse is coming to give you an injection.
sentences.chinese: 护士会来给你打针。

sentences.english: The school nurse sent Sara home.
sentences.chinese: 学校的护士送萨拉回家。

sentences.english: a male nurse
sentences.chinese: 男护士

sentences.english: a senior nurse
sentences.chinese: 高级护士

sentences.english: a student nurse (= someone who is learning to be a nurse )
sentences.chinese: 实习护士

sentences.english: a psychiatric nurse (= a nurse for people who are mentally ill )
sentences.chinese: 精神病院护士

sentences.english: He’s been nursing an elderly relative.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在照顾一位年老的亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to look after people who are ill or injured, usually in a hospital
to look after someone who is ill or injured

sentences.english: Police in the city have been cleaning up the debris left by a day of violent confrontation.
sentences.chinese: 城里的警察一直在收拾一天的暴力冲突留下的残骸。

detailed_translations.english: If you clean up a mess or clean up a place where there is a mess, you make things neat and free of dirt again

sentences.english: Everybody cheered when the firemen arrived.
sentences.chinese: 消防员到达时，大家都欢呼起来。

sentences.english: The audience was shouting and cheering.
sentences.chinese: 观众在呐喊欢呼。

sentences.english: The spectators cheered him wildly.
sentences.chinese: 观众拼命为他加油。

detailed_translations.english: to shout as a way of showing happiness, praise, approval, or support of someone or something

detailed_translations.chinese: 欢呼；愉快；心情；令人愉快的事
detailed_translations.english: a shout of happiness, praise, approval, or encouragement

sentences.english: I think he misses her terribly. You might cheer him up.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得他太想念她了。你也许能使他振作起来。

sentences.english: I wrote that song just to cheer myself up.
sentences.chinese: 我写了那首歌只是让自己振作起来。

detailed_translations.english: When you cheer up or when something cheers you up, you stop feeling depressed and become more cheerful

sentences.english: The radiator gives out a lot of heat.
sentences.chinese: 散热器释放出大量的热。

sentences.english: There were people at the entrance giving out leaflets.
sentences.chinese: 有人在入口处分发传单。

detailed_translations.english: to produce sth such as heat, light, etc.

sentences.english: Most of the relief work was done by volunteers.
sentences.chinese: 大部分救援工作都由志愿人员完成。

sentences.english: I volunteered my services as a driver.
sentences.chinese: 我主动提出来当司机。

detailed_translations.english: someone who does a job willingly without being paid
to offer to do something without expecting any reward, often something that other people do not want to do

sentences.english: You would take things as they came. All you had to do was think a little harder and come up with a new solution.
sentences.chinese: 既来之, 则安之， 你必须多动脑子， 想出个新的解决方法来。

sentences.english: I come up with half of my blog post ideas while I am cooking (the other half I get while running) so you can use cooking to come up with new ideas for your life.
sentences.chinese: 当我烹饪时我想出了一半的博客日志（另一半跑步时就想出来了）所以你可以用烹饪为你的生活想出一些好的想法。

sentences.english: Women who put off having a baby often make the best mothers.
sentences.chinese: 晚育的妇女常常会成为最佳母亲。

detailed_translations.english: If you put something off, you delay doing it

sentences.english: the dollar sign
sentences.chinese: 美元符号

sentences.english: a minus sign
sentences.chinese: 减号

sentences.english: a sign on the door
sentences.chinese: 门上的标牌

sentences.english: Sign here, please.
sentences.chinese: 请在这里签字。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or shape that has a particular meaning
to write your signature on something to show that you wrote it, agree with it, or were present

sentences.english: He noticed a woman in a black dress sitting across from him.
sentences.chinese: 他看到有位黑衣女子坐在他的对面。

sentences.english: I didn’t notice any smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我没注意到有烟。

sentences.english: Have you noticed any change in him?
sentences.chinese: 你注意到他有什么变化了吗？

sentences.english: I waved but they took no notice.
sentences.chinese: 我挥了挥手，可是他们没有注意到。

sentences.english: Firefighters were prepared to rush out at a moment’s notice.
sentences.chinese: 消防队员准备着随时出动。

detailed_translations.english: if you notice something or someone, you realize that they exist, especially because you can see, hear, or feel them
when you notice or pay attention to someone or something

sentences.english: One of my jobs was to hand out the prizes.
sentences.chinese: 我的工作之一是分发奖品。

detailed_translations.english: If you hand things out to people, you give one or more to each person in a group

name: call up
trans: 打电话给…某人，征召；征召

sentences.english: When I'm in Pittsburgh, I call him up.
sentences.chinese: 到匹兹堡后，我会给他打电话。

sentences.english: He called up the museum.
sentences.chinese: 他往博物馆打了电话。

sentences.english: The United States has called up some 150,000 military reservists.
sentences.chinese: 美国已招募了约十五万预备役军人。

detailed_translations.chinese: 打电话给…某人，征召；征召
detailed_translations.english: If you call someone up, you telephone them

sentences.english: He used to go to our school.
sentences.chinese: 他曾在我们学校就读。

sentences.english: We’re eating out more often than we used to.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在出去吃饭的次数比以前多了。

detailed_translations.english: if something used to happen, it happened regularly or all the time in the past, but does not happen now

sentences.english: a lonely old man
sentences.chinese: 一个孤单的老人

sentences.english: Don’t you get lonely being on your own all day?
sentences.chinese: 你整天独自一人不感到寂寞吗？

detailed_translations.english: unhappy because you are alone or do not have anyone to talk to

sentences.english: She moved back home to care for her elderly parents.
sentences.chinese: 她搬回家住，好照料年迈的双亲。

detailed_translations.english: to look after sb who is sick, very old, very young, etc

sentences.english: I have several suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个建议。

sentences.english: I have several methods.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个方法。

sentences.english: I have several reasons to support my view.
sentences.chinese: 我有几个理由来支持我的观点。

sentences.english: He was a big strong man.
sentences.chinese: 他高大健壮。

sentences.english: Jack was tall and strong.
sentences.chinese: 杰克又高又壮。

sentences.english: I’m not strong enough to fight him.
sentences.chinese: 和他打我还不够强壮。

detailed_translations.chinese: 坚强的；强壮的；牢固的；擅长的
detailed_translations.english: having a lot of physical power so that you can lift heavy things, do hard physical work etc

sentences.english: Knowing we’d won was a wonderful feeling.
sentences.chinese: 得知我们赢了，感觉真好。

sentences.english: He’s considerate of other people’s feelings.
sentences.chinese: 他很顾及他人的感情。

detailed_translations.english: an emotion that you feel, such as anger, sadness, or happiness

sentences.english: She got great satisfaction from helping people to learn.
sentences.chinese: 她在帮助人们学习的过程中得到很大的满足。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of happiness or pleasure because you have achieved something or got what you wanted

sentences.english: the look of joy on her face
sentences.chinese: 她脸上的喜悦表情

sentences.english: The garden was his pride and joy.
sentences.chinese: 这座花园是他的骄傲和乐趣所在。

detailed_translations.english: great happiness and pleasure

sentences.english: He was now the proud owner of a bright red sports car.
sentences.chinese: 他现在拥有了一辆亮红色跑车，很是自豪。

detailed_translations.english: someone who owns something

sentences.chinese: 我想下个周末去试一下这艘船。

sentences.english: Some owners wish they could try out the car in a race track.
sentences.chinese: 一些车主希望他们能在一条跑道上试一下那辆车。

detailed_translations.english: If you try something out, you test it in order to find out how useful or effective it is or what it is like

sentences.english: the friends they made on the journey
sentences.chinese: 他们在旅途中交下的朋友

detailed_translations.english: an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially over a long distance
an occasion when you travel from one place to another, especially over a long distance

sentences.english: He did not raise the subject again.
sentences.chinese: 他再也没有提起这个话题。

sentences.english: I’d like to raise the issue of publicity.
sentences.chinese: 我想提一提宣传问题。

sentences.english: Betty raised the important question of who will be in charge.
sentences.chinese: 贝蒂提出了一个重要问题，就是将由谁来负责。

detailed_translations.english: to begin to talk or write about a subject that you want to be considered or a question that you think should be answered

sentences.english: She lives alone.
sentences.chinese: 她一个人生活。

sentences.english: You shouldn’t leave a child alone in the house.
sentences.chinese: 你不应该把小孩独自留在家里。

sentences.english: My wife and I like to spend time alone together away from the kids.
sentences.chinese: 我和妻子喜欢没有孩子打扰，过二人世界。

sentences.english: She has lived alone in this house for almost five years now.
sentences.chinese: 她现在已经独自在这所房子里住了差不多五年了。

detailed_translations.english: if you are alone in a place, there is no one with you
without any help from other people

sentences.english: Dad was up the ladder, repairing the roof.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸在梯子上修补屋顶。

sentences.english: Where can I get my shoes repaired ?
sentences.chinese: 哪儿能修补鞋子？

sentences.english: The church tower is in need of repair.
sentences.chinese: 教堂的塔楼需要修缮。

detailed_translations.english: to fix something that is damaged, broken, split, or not working properly
something that you do to fix a thing that is damaged, broken, or not working

sentences.chinese: 利率已经定为6.5%。

sentences.english: The shelves should be fixed to the wall with screws.
sentences.chinese: 架子应当用螺丝固定在墙上。

detailed_translations.english: to decide on a limit for something, especially prices, costs etc, so that they do not change

sentences.chinese: 我已经把马修的旧房间修缮好了。

detailed_translations.english: If you fix something up, you do work that is necessary in order to make it more suitable or attractive

sentences.english: He was giving his collection away for free.
sentences.chinese: 他正在无偿捐赠他的收藏。

sentences.english: She would give nothing away.
sentences.chinese: 她什么也不会泄露。

detailed_translations.english: If you give away something that you own, you give it to someone, rather than selling it, often because you no longer want it.

sentences.english: She was a smart, brave woman. You take after her.
sentences.chinese: 她是一名聪明、勇敢的女子。你像她。

detailed_translations.english: If you take after a member of your family, you resemble them in your appearance, your behaviour, or your character

sentences.english: Mind the broken glass.
sentences.chinese: 当心碎玻璃。

sentences.english: a badly broken leg
sentences.chinese: 严重骨折的腿

sentences.english: Gibbs had an X-ray, which revealed no broken bones.
sentences.chinese: 吉布斯拍了X光片，显示没有骨折。

detailed_translations.english: in small pieces because it has been hit, dropped etc

sentences.english: Shall I take the wheel (= drive instead of someone else )?
sentences.chinese: 我来开车好吗？

detailed_translations.english: one of the round things under a car, bus, bicycle etc that turns when it moves

detailed_translations.chinese: 转动；使变换方向；给…装轮子
detailed_translations.english: to push something that has wheels somewhere

sentences.chinese: 今天我收到梅拉妮的一封信。

sentences.english: There are 26 letters in the English alphabet.
sentences.chinese: 英语字母表有26个字母。

detailed_translations.english: a written or printed message that is usually put in an envelope and sent by mail

sentences.english: It was nice talking to you, Miss Ellis.
sentences.chinese: 很高兴与你交谈，埃利斯小姐。

detailed_translations.chinese: 女士，小姐，年轻未婚女子
detailed_translations.english: You use Miss in front of the name of a girl or unmarried woman when you are speaking to her or referring to her

sentences.english: The two sides agreed to set up a commission to investigate claims.
sentences.chinese: 双方同意成立一个委员会，调查索赔问题。

sentences.english: ...an organization which sets up meetings about issues of interest to women.
sentences.chinese: …一个安排有关妇女利益问题的会议组织。

detailed_translations.english: If you set something up, you create or arrange it

sentences.english: a support group for parents of disabled children
sentences.chinese: 帮助残障儿童父母的援助团

sentences.english: a severely disabled polio patient
sentences.chinese: 严重残疾的小儿麻痺症病人

sentences.english: teachers who work with learning disabled children (= children who have problems learning )
sentences.chinese: 教有学习障碍的儿童的教师

detailed_translations.english: someone who is disabled cannot use a part of their body properly, or cannot learn easily

detailed_translations.chinese: 使…失去能力（disable的过去分词）

sentences.english: Whatever she did, it made no difference. ＃
sentences.chinese: 不管她做什么都没有用。

detailed_translations.english: to have an important effect or influence on something or someone

name: blind
trans: 盲的，失明的；盲的，盲目的

sentences.english: Doctors think he will go blind.
sentences.chinese: 医生们认为他会失明。

sentences.english: blind faith/obedience
sentences.chinese: 盲目的信念；盲从

detailed_translations.english: not able to see

sentences.english: communication between deaf and hearing people
sentences.chinese: 失聪者和听力正常者之间的交流

sentences.english: I think Mum’s going a bit deaf .
sentences.chinese: 我觉得妈妈有点耳聋了。

sentences.english: She’s deaf and dumb (= unable to hear or speak ) and communicates using sign language.
sentences.chinese: 她又聋又哑，用手语交流。

sentences.english: She was deaf to his pleas.
sentences.chinese: 她对他的恳求充耳不闻。

detailed_translations.english: physically unable to hear anything or unable to hear well

sentences.english: Imagine that you have just won a million pounds.
sentences.chinese: 设想你刚刚赢得一百万英镑。

sentences.english: He didn’t quite dare to imagine himself as a real artist.
sentences.chinese: 他不太敢把自己想象成一个真正的艺术家。

detailed_translations.english: to form a picture or idea in your mind about what something could be like

sentences.english: They had great difficulty in finding a replacement.
sentences.chinese: 他们找接替的人费了很大劲

sentences.english: If you have any difficulties, give me a call.
sentences.chinese: 如果你遇到困难，就给我打电话。

sentences.english: She soon got into difficulty with debt.
sentences.chinese: 她很快就因债务陷入了困境。

detailed_translations.english: if you have difficulty doing something, it is difficult for you to do

sentences.english: He threw the door open and ran down the stairs.
sentences.chinese: 他猛地打开门，往楼下跑去。

sentences.english: an open window
sentences.chinese: 打开的窗户

sentences.english: The gates swung silently open.
sentences.chinese: 大门悄悄地打开了。

sentences.english: The bar door flew open and a noisy group burst in.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧的门猛地弹开，冲进来一群吵吵闹闹的人。

sentences.english: All the windows were wide open (= completely open ).
sentences.chinese: 所有的窗户都大开着。

sentences.english: The museum is open daily in the summer months.
sentences.chinese: 夏季里这座博物馆每天开放。

sentences.english: Jack opened the window.
sentences.chinese: 杰克打开窗户。

detailed_translations.english: not closed, so that things, people, air etc can go in and out or be put in and out
to move a door, window etc so that people, things, air etc can pass through, or to be moved in this way

sentences.english: Could you open the door for me?
sentences.chinese: 请你帮我开门好吗？

sentences.english: The door flew open and Ruth stormed in.
sentences.chinese: 门一下子打开了，露丝气冲冲地跑了进来。

sentences.english: Don’t forget to lock the garage door.
sentences.chinese: 别忘了把车库的门锁上。
