sentences.chinese: 马克从房间另一端的门口出现。

sentences.english: the family that lives three doors up from us
sentences.chinese: 住在与我们相隔三户的那户人家

detailed_translations.english: a piece of wood, glass, etc. that is opened and closed so that people can get in and out of a room, building, car, etc.; a similar thing in a cupboard/closet

sentences.english: The morning paper carried a story about demonstrations in New York and Washington D.C.
sentences.chinese: 晨报登载了纽约和华盛顿特区举行示威游行的报道。

sentences.english: The national TV network carries religious programmes.
sentences.chinese: 全国电视网播出宗教节目。

detailed_translations.english: if a newspaper, a television or radio broadcast, or a website carries a piece of news, an advertisement etc, it prints it or broadcasts it

sentences.english: We went all the way to Inverness by train.
sentences.chinese: 我们一路坐火车到因弗内斯。

detailed_translations.english: a set of several carriages that are connected to each other and pulled along a railway line by an engine
to teach someone the skills of a particular job or activity, or to be taught these skills

sentences.english: Police drivers have to undergo intensive training .
sentences.chinese: 警察驾驶员都得接受强化训练。

sentences.english: a rigorous training session
sentences.chinese: 一节严格的训练课

sentences.english: On-the-job training will be supplemented by classroom lectures.
sentences.chinese: 除了在职培训，还将有课堂授课作为补充。

sentences.english: The shop opens late on Fridays because of staff training .
sentences.chinese: 因为员工培训，这家商店周五较晚开门营业。

detailed_translations.english: the process of teaching or being taught the skills for a particular job or activity

sentences.english: Steve flies home tomorrow – we’re all really excited.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂夫明天坐飞机回家——我们都非常激动。

sentences.english: The food was nothing to get excited about (= not very good or special ).
sentences.chinese: 食物很一般，没什么特别。

sentences.english: excited crowds of shoppers
sentences.chinese: 兴奋的购物人群

detailed_translations.english: happy, interested, or hopeful because something good has happened or will happen

sentences.english: I can’t thank you enough for your kindness.
sentences.chinese: 你的好意我感激不尽。

detailed_translations.english: kind behaviour towards someone

sentences.english: a clever man
sentences.chinese: 聪明的人

detailed_translations.english: able to learn and understand things quickly

sentences.english: She doesn’t understand English.
sentences.chinese: 她不懂英语。

sentences.english: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Can yon explain that again?
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我不明白。你能再解释一遍吗？

sentences.english: The woman had a strong accent, and I couldn’t understand what she was saying.
sentences.chinese: 那女人口音很重，我听不懂她在说些什么。

detailed_translations.english: to know the meaning of what someone is telling you, or the language that they speak

sentences.english: I find it hard to cope with change.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得很难适应变化。

sentences.english: scientists worried about climatic change
sentences.chinese: 为气候变化感到担忧的科学家们

sentences.english: A change in personality may mean your teenager has a drug problem.
sentences.chinese: 十几岁的孩子如果性格上发生了变化，可能意味着有吸毒问题。

sentences.english: No major changes were made to the book.
sentences.chinese: 这本书没有大的修改。

sentences.english: She had a change of heart (= change in attitude ) and decided to stay.
sentences.chinese: 她改变主意，决定留下来。

sentences.english: Family life has undergone dramatic change in recent years.
sentences.chinese: 近年来家庭生活发生了巨大的变化。

sentences.english: Matt emptied the loose change from his pockets.
sentences.chinese: 马特把口袋里所有的零钱都掏了出来。

detailed_translations.english: the process or result of something or someone becoming different

sentences.english: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
sentences.chinese: 我看了前几集，但很快就失去了兴趣。

sentences.english: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。

sentences.english: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣，这很令人不安。

sentences.english: I read your article with great interest.
sentences.chinese: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

sentences.english: to promote/protect/safeguard sb's interests
sentences.chinese: 为某人的利益游说；保护 / 维护某人的利益

sentences.english: The money was repaid with interest.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱是带息偿还的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about sb/sth

sentences.english: ‘Report back to me in an hour, sergeant.’ ‘Yes, sir.’
sentences.chinese: “一小时后向我报告，中士。”“是，长官。”

sentences.english: Can I help you, sir?
sentences.chinese: 我能为您效劳吗，先生？

sentences.english: Sir! You dropped your wallet.
sentences.chinese: 先生！ 您的钱包掉了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 先生；（用于姓名前）爵士；阁下；（中小学生对男教师的称呼）先生；老师
detailed_translations.english: used when speaking to a man in order to be polite or show respect

sentences.english: Are you being served, Madam?
sentences.chinese: 有人接待您吗，夫人？

detailed_translations.english: used to address a woman in a polite way, especially a customer in a shop

sentences.english: a rubbish bin
sentences.chinese: 垃圾桶

detailed_translations.english: food, paper etc that is no longer needed and has been thrown away

sentences.english: His father forced him to take out the rubbish.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲强迫他把垃圾拿出去倒了。

sentences.english: He has already learned to take out the rubbish and follow simple commands.
sentences.chinese: 他已经学会了丢垃圾和一些简单的命令。

sentences.english: They mop floors, take out the rubbish, walk the dog, buy groceries and care for the children, the elderly or disabled.
sentences.chinese: 她们拖地，倒垃圾，遛狗，卖杂货，带孩子，照顾老人和残疾人。

sentences.english: Fold the paper along the dotted line.
sentences.chinese: 沿虚线将纸折起来。

sentences.english: It’ll fit in if you fold it in half .
sentences.chinese: 对折的话就能放下了。

detailed_translations.english: to bend a piece of paper, cloth etc by laying or pressing one part over another
a line made in paper or material when you fold one part of it over another

sentences.english: What a mess!
sentences.chinese: 太乱了！

sentences.english: Sorry – the place is a bit of a mess .
sentences.chinese: 对不起——这里有些乱。

sentences.english: When I got home, the house was a complete mess .
sentences.chinese: 我回到家时，屋子里一片狼藉。

sentences.english: You can make cookies if you promise not to make a mess in the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 如果你答应不把厨房搞得乱七八糟，你可以去做甜饼。

sentences.english: She hates mess.
sentences.chinese: 她讨厌到处乱糟糟的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 凌乱状态，混乱的局面；困境
detailed_translations.english: if there is a mess somewhere or a place is a mess, things there are dirty or not neatly arranged

detailed_translations.chinese: 弄糟， 弄脏， 搞乱
detailed_translations.english: to make something look untidy or dirty

sentences.english: The bus stopped suddenly and we were all thrown forwards.
sentences.chinese: 公共汽车猛地停住，我们都往前栽。

detailed_translations.chinese: [threw-thrown] 投， 扔， 抛； 使突然陷入； 使困惑， 使吃惊
detailed_translations.english: to make an object such as a ball move quickly through the air by pushing your hand forward quickly and letting the object go
constantly or very frequently

sentences.english: Neither Oleg’s mother nor his father spoke English.
sentences.chinese: 奥列格的父母都不会说英语。

sentences.english: The equipment is neither accurate nor safe.
sentences.chinese: 这台设备既不精确，也不安全。

detailed_translations.english: used when mentioning two things that are not true or possible
used to show that a negative statement is also true about another person or thing

sentences.english: I have to wear a shirt and tie to work.
sentences.chinese: 我上班要穿衬衫打领带。

sentences.english: a check shirt
sentences.chinese: 格子衬衫

detailed_translations.english: a piece of clothing that covers the upper part of your body and your arms, usually has a collar, and is fastened at the front by buttons

sentences.english: The crowd parted to let the truck pass.
sentences.chinese: 人群分开让卡车通过。

sentences.english: He gave me a smile as he passed.
sentences.chinese: 他经过时对我微笑了一下。

sentences.english: We passed a group of students outside the theatre.
sentences.chinese: 我们在戏院外从一群学生身旁经过。

sentences.english: I pass the sports centre on the way to work.
sentences.chinese: 我上班的路上经过体育中心。

sentences.english: The road passes right through the town centre.
sentences.chinese: 那条路正好穿过镇中心。

sentences.english: We passed the winter pleasantly enough.
sentences.chinese: 我们相当愉快地度过了那个冬季。

detailed_translations.english: to come up to a particular place, person, or object and go past them

sentences.english: Can I borrow your pen for a minute?
sentences.chinese: 我可以借你的笔用一下吗？

sentences.english: They borrowed heavily (=  borrowed a lot of money  ) from the bank to start their new business.
sentences.chinese: 他们向银行贷了巨款来创办新公司。

detailed_translations.english: to use something that belongs to someone else and that you must give back to them later

sentences.english: The hospital agreed to lend us a wheelchair.
sentences.chinese: 医院同意借给我们一把轮椅。

sentences.english: The bank is reassessing its criteria for lending money.
sentences.chinese: 银行正在重新评估其贷款标准。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone borrow money or something that belongs to you for a short time

sentences.english: The woman had a ring on her finger, so I assumed she was married.
sentences.chinese: 那女人手指上戴着戒指，因此我猜想她已经结婚了。

sentences.english: We ate with our fingers.
sentences.chinese: 我们用手抓着吃。

detailed_translations.english: one of the four long thin parts on your hand, not including your thumb

sentences.english: It’s the kind of movie you either love or hate.
sentences.chinese: 这是那种你要么喜欢要么讨厌的电影。

sentences.english: He hates his job.
sentences.chinese: 他讨厌自己的工作。

detailed_translations.english: to dislike something very much

sentences.english: everyday chores like shopping and housework
sentences.chinese: 购物和做家务之类的日常琐事

sentences.english: We share the domestic chores.
sentences.chinese: 我们分担家务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 家庭杂务；日常的零星事务；讨厌的或累人的工作
detailed_translations.english: a small job that you have to do regularly, especially work that you do to keep a house clean

sentences.english: They arrived while we were having dinner.
sentences.chinese: 他们来时我们正在吃饭。

sentences.english: While she was asleep, thieves broke in and stole her handbag.
sentences.chinese: 她睡着的时候，小偷闯进来偷走了她的手提包。

sentences.english: She met Andy while working on a production of Carmen.
sentences.chinese: 排练《卡门》时，她认识了安迪。

detailed_translations.english: during the time that something is happening
to spend time in a pleasant and lazy way

sentences.english: I grabbed a quick snack.
sentences.chinese: 我赶紧吃了点零食。

sentences.english: Drinks and light snacks are served at the bar.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧里供应饮料和小吃。

sentences.english: snack foods like crisps and peanuts
sentences.chinese: 炸薯片和花生之类的小吃

detailed_translations.english: a small amount of food that is eaten between main meals or instead of a meal

sentences.english: Crawford stressed the need for more housing downtown.
sentences.chinese: 克劳福德强调市中心需要建更多的住宅。

sentences.english: She stressed the importance of a balanced diet.
sentences.chinese: 她强调了均衡饮食的重要性。

detailed_translations.english: to emphasize a statement, fact, or idea

sentences.english: excessive waste in state spending
sentences.chinese: 政府支出方面的过度浪费

detailed_translations.chinese: 浪费；废物；荒地；损耗；地面风化物
detailed_translations.english: when something such as money or skills are not used in a way that is effective, useful, or sensible
to use more money, time, energy etc than is useful or sensible
waste materials, substances etc are unwanted because the good part of them has been removed

sentences.english: Jack and Helen had dropped behind in order to be alone.
sentences.chinese: 为了单独呆在一起，杰克和海伦故意让别人走在前面。

sentences.english: He polished off his work in order to see his girlfriend.
sentences.chinese: 为了去见女朋友，他匆忙地做完手头的工作。

sentences.english: She decathected from him in order to cope with his impending bankruptcy.
sentences.chinese: 为了对付他的即将来临的破产，她不再依恋他。

sentences.english: Tea and biscuits will be provided.
sentences.chinese: 有茶水和饼干供应。

detailed_translations.english: to give something to someone or make it available to them, because they need it or want it

sentences.english: I know I'll be confronted with difficulties, but I will squeak by anyway.
sentences.chinese: 我知道我会遇到许多困难，可我无论如何总能应付过去。

detailed_translations.english: used to indicate that a statement explains or supports a previous statement

sentences.english: He depended on his writing for his income.
sentences.chinese: 他靠写作谋生。

sentences.english: You can depend on Jane – she always keeps her promises.
sentences.chinese: 你可以相信简——她一向都信守诺言。

detailed_translations.english: to need the support, help, or existence of someone or something in order to exist, be healthy, be successful etc

sentences.english: Some of them depend on what your program does.
sentences.chinese: 其中一些取决于您的程序要做什么。

sentences.english: It all depend on whether he like the boss or not.
sentences.chinese: 这完全取决于他是否喜欢这个老闆。

sentences.english: Knowledge in the field of genetics has been developing very rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 遗传学领域的知识发展非常迅速。

sentences.english: Corsica has developed its economy around the tourist industry.
sentences.chinese: 科西嘉岛的经济是围绕旅游业发展起来的。

sentences.english: exercises to develop muscle strength
sentences.chinese: 锻炼肌肉力量的运动

sentences.english: He had developed a certain affection for me.
sentences.chinese: 他对我产生了一些好感。

sentences.english: The land was developed for low-cost housing.
sentences.chinese: 这块土地被开发建造廉价住宅。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually grow or become bigger, more advanced, stronger, etc.; to make sth do this

name: independent
trans: 独立自主的，不受约束的

sentences.english: There are plans to split the corporation into a number of smaller independent companies.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要把这家大企业分割成一些独立的小公司。

sentences.english: an independent charity
sentences.chinese: 独立的慈善机构

sentences.english: small independent bookshops
sentences.chinese: 私营小书店

sentences.english: schools in the independent sector
sentences.chinese: 私立学校

detailed_translations.english: an independent organization is not owned or controlled by, or does not receive money from, another organization or the government

sentences.english: The country has made great advances since independence.
sentences.chinese: 该国自独立以来发展迅速。

detailed_translations.chinese: 独立； 自主； 自立
detailed_translations.english: political freedom from control by the government of another country

sentences.english: a fair maiden
sentences.chinese: 美丽的少女

detailed_translations.english: pleasant and attractive

sentences.english: an unfair advantage
sentences.chinese: 不公平的优势

sentences.english: laws aimed at preventing unfair competition
sentences.chinese: 旨在防止不公平竞争的法令

sentences.english: Many employers have recognized that age discrimination is unfair.
sentences.chinese: 许多雇主已经认识到年龄歧视是不公平的。

sentences.english: She won £20,000 for unfair dismissal(= being illegally made to leave your job ).
sentences.chinese: 她因被不公平解雇而得到两万英镑的赔偿。

detailed_translations.english: not right or fair, especially because not everyone has an equal opportunity

sentences.english: the basic fairness of the judicial system
sentences.chinese: 司法制度的基本公正性

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being fair

sentences.english: We’ve been waiting here since two o’clock.
sentences.chinese: 我们从两点钟开始就在这里等了。

sentences.english: I haven’t played rugby since I left university.
sentences.chinese: 我大学毕业后就没打过橄榄球。

sentences.english: She left London ten years ago, and I haven’t seen her since.
sentences.chinese: 她十年前离开伦敦，此后我再没有见过她。

sentences.english: The factory has been here since the 1970s.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂从 20 世纪 70 年代起就在这里了。

sentences.english: It was exactly five years since her father had died.
sentences.chinese: 从她父亲去世到现在正好满五年。

sentences.english: Since the end of the war, over five thousand prisoners have been released.
sentences.chinese: 自从战争结束以后，已有五千多名战俘获释。

sentences.english: He lost his job five years ago, but has since found other work.
sentences.chinese: 他五年前失去工作，但此后找到了其他工作。

sentences.english: I left school in 1995, and since then I’ve lived in London.
sentences.chinese: 我 1995 年离开学校，此后就在伦敦生活。

sentences.english: About six thousand people were arrested, several hundred of whom have since been released.
sentences.chinese: 约六千人被逮捕，不过他们中有几百人后来被释放了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 因为；由于；既然；自…以来；自…以后

detailed_translations.english: from a particular time or event in the past until the present, or in that period of time
When you are talking about an event or situation in the past, you use since to indicate that another event happened at some point later in time

sentences.english: I parked my baby at the neighbor's house.
sentences.chinese: 我把小孩寄放在邻居家里。

sentences.english: It means you love Him with all your heart, and you love your neighbor as yourself.
sentences.chinese: 它意味着你全心全意的爱上帝并且像爱自己那样爱邻居。

sentences.english: See, if you break any one of those commandments, you do not love your neighbor as yourself.
sentences.chinese: 看，如果你违反了其中任何一条戒律，你就没能像爱自己那样爱邻居。

sentences.english: I always used to laugh to myself when I heard people say that we need to take care of ourselves in order to be able to take care of others.
sentences.chinese: 我听到一些人说要照顾好我们自己，这样我们才有能力去照顾好别人。 不知道为什么，当我听到这句话的时候，我经常笑我自己。

sentences.english: Because the office refrigerator is unowned by any individual, no one feels responsibility to take care of it, and certainly no one wants to take time out of his or her busy workday to do so.
sentences.chinese: 办公室里的冰箱因为不属于任何一个个人，没有人觉得自己有责任去管理或者照顾它，当然也没人在繁忙的工作时间抽出时间去做那些事情。

sentences.english: Bridget can’t come – she’s ill.
sentences.chinese: 布里奇特不能来了，她生病了。

sentences.english: He was unable to join the army because of ill health.
sentences.chinese: 他因为身体不好没法参军。

sentences.english: The animals had been grossly ill-treated.
sentences.chinese: 那些动物受到了恣意虐待。

detailed_translations.english: suffering from a disease or not feeling well
badly or in an unpleasant way

sentences.english: Your button has dropped off.
sentences.chinese: 你的纽扣掉了。

sentences.english: The number of deaths on the roads has dropped sharply.
sentences.chinese: 交通事故死亡人数已大大减少。

detailed_translations.english: to fall suddenly onto the ground or into something

sentences.english: We don’t allow diving in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 泳池内禁止跳水。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen

sentences.english: You’ve spelt my name wrong.
sentences.chinese: 你把我的名字拼错了。

sentences.english: What? Have I done it wrong ?
sentences.chinese: 什么？我做得不对吗？

sentences.english: I asked him to sort those files, but he’s done it all wrong (= in completely the wrong way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我让他整理这些文件，可是他弄得根本不对。

sentences.english: I must have added it up wrong, then.
sentences.chinese: 那我一定是加错了。

sentences.english: It looks like it's spelled wrong.
sentences.chinese: 看起来像是拼错了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 错误地；邪恶地，不正当地
detailed_translations.english: not in the correct way
behaviour that is not morally right

detailed_translations.chinese: 错误的；失常的；不适当的
detailed_translations.english: not correct, and not based on true facts
Wrong is also an adverb

sentences.english: You can’t phone her now – it’s gone midnight (= after midnight ) !
sentences.chinese: 你现在不能打电话给她，都过午夜了！

sentences.english: By the time he arrived, it was well past midnight (= after midnight ) .
sentences.chinese: 他到的时候早已经是后半夜了。

sentences.english: He’s gone for a midnight swim.
sentences.chinese: 他深更半夜去游泳了。

detailed_translations.english: 12 o’clock at night

sentences.english: Peter starts looking through the mail as soon as the door shuts.
sentences.chinese: 门一关上，彼得就开始查看邮件。

detailed_translations.english: If you look through a group of things, you examine each one so that you can find or choose the one that you want

sentences.english: I’d say he’s around 50, but I’m only guessing.
sentences.chinese: 我想他50岁左右，不过也只是猜测。

sentences.english: What star sign are you? No, let me guess.
sentences.chinese: 你是什么星座的？别说，让我来猜猜看。

sentences.english: I’d say she’s about 35, but that’s only a guess.
sentences.chinese: 我说她大约35岁，不过那只是猜测。

detailed_translations.english: to try to answer a question or form an opinion when you are not sure whether you will be correct
an attempt to answer a question or make a judgement when you are not sure whether you will be correct

sentences.english: The prime minister promised farmers a new deal (= a new and fairer system ) .
sentences.chinese: 首相向农民保证推行一项新政策。

detailed_translations.english: treatment of a particular type that is given or received

sentences.english: This audition is a big deal for Joey.
sentences.chinese: 这次试演对乔伊来说是一件大事。

detailed_translations.english: an important or exciting event or situation

sentences.english: Negotiators are due to meet later today to work out a compromise.
sentences.chinese: 谈判者们预定在今天晚些时候会面以找到一个折中的办法。

sentences.english: It took me some time to work out what was causing this.
sentences.chinese: 它花了我一些时间，找到导致这种状况的原因。

sentences.english: Things just didn't work out as planned.
sentences.chinese: 事情没有像计划的那样进展顺利。

detailed_translations.english: If you work out a solution to a problem or mystery, you manage to find the solution by thinking or talking about it

sentences.english: We do not get on well together.
sentences.chinese: 我们相处得不融洽。

detailed_translations.english: Have a harmonious or friendly relationship

sentences.english: diplomatic/international/foreign relations
sentences.chinese: 外交 / 国际 / 对外关系

sentences.english: a close/near/distant relation of mine
sentences.chinese: 我的一位近亲 / 远亲

detailed_translations.english: the way in which two people, groups or countries behave towards each other or deal with each other

sentences.english: We communicated mostly by e-mail.
sentences.chinese: 我们主要是用电子邮件沟通。

sentences.english: A baby communicates its needs by crying.
sentences.chinese: 婴儿用哭来表达需要。

detailed_translations.english: to exchange information or conversation with other people, using words, signs, writing etc

sentences.english: Radio was the pilot’s only means of communication.
sentences.chinese: 无线电是飞行员唯一的通信手段。

sentences.english: There has been a breakdown in communication (= failure to communicate ) .
sentences.chinese: 沟通失败。

sentences.english: Paris has good communications with many European cities.
sentences.chinese: 巴黎与许多欧洲城市之间交通便捷。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which people exchange information or express their thoughts and feelings

sentences.english: We could hear the neighbours arguing.
sentences.chinese: 我们听到邻居在争吵。

detailed_translations.english: to disagree with someone in words, often in an angry way
to persuade someone to do or not do something

sentences.english: Dark clouds floated across the moon.
sentences.chinese: 乌云飘过月亮。

sentences.english: A cloud of steam rose into the air.
sentences.chinese: 一团水蒸气升到空中。

sentences.english: Fears of renewed terrorist attacks cast a cloud over the event (= spoilt the happy situation ) .
sentences.chinese: 对恐怖分子再次发动袭击的担心给这次活动蒙上了一层阴影。

detailed_translations.english: a white or grey mass in the sky that forms from very small drops of water

sentences.english: Sarah is the elder of the two.
sentences.chinese: 两人当中萨拉年纪较长。

sentences.english: a meeting of the village elders
sentences.chinese: 村里长辈们的集会

detailed_translations.english: the elder of two people, especially brothers and sisters, is the one who was born first
a member of a tribe or other social group who is important and respected because they are old

sentences.english: You probably picked up my keys instead of yours.
sentences.chinese: 你可能没拿你的钥匙而错拿了我的。

sentences.english: Could I have tuna instead of ham?
sentences.chinese: 我可否要金枪鱼来代替火腿？

sentences.english: Instead of being annoyed, he seemed quite pleased.
sentences.chinese: 他没有生气，反而似乎很高兴。

detailed_translations.english: used to say what is not used, does not happen etc, when something else is used, happens etc

name: whatever
trans: 任何；不管什么,无论什么

sentences.english: She has shown no interest whatever in anything scientific.
sentences.chinese: 凡是与科学有关的她都没有表现出任何兴趣。

sentences.english: This is just a stupid argument that has nothing whatever to do with your job.
sentences.chinese: 这只是一场无聊的争论，和你的工作没有任何关系。

detailed_translations.chinese: [用于否定句中以加强语气]任何； 无论什么
detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize a negative statement

sentences.english: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
sentences.chinese: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了，你让我紧张。

sentences.english: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck (= was extremely nervous ).
sentences.chinese: 到了面试的时候，我紧张得要命。

detailed_translations.english: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax

sentences.english: Can I offer you something to drink?
sentences.chinese: 我给你拿点喝的好吗？

sentences.english: I can’t turn down the offer of a free trip to Milan!
sentences.chinese: 我怎能拒绝免费去米兰旅行的机会！

detailed_translations.english: to ask someone if they would like to have something, or to hold something out to them so that they can take it
a statement saying that you are willing to do something for someone or give them something

sentences.english: It is right and proper that parents take responsibility for their children's attendance at school.
sentences.chinese: 父母负责督促子女上学上课，这是天经地义的事。

sentences.english: He is always perfectly proper in his behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为举止向来是无可挑剔的。

detailed_translations.english: socially and morally acceptable

sentences.english: Firstly, they are not efficient, and secondly, they are expensive to make.
sentences.chinese: 首先，它们效率不高，其次，它们的制作成本很高。

detailed_translations.english: used when you want to give a second point or fact, or give a second reason for something

sentences.english: He carefully explained the procedure.
sentences.chinese: 他仔细解释了程序。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone about something in a way that is clear or easy to understand

sentences.english: clear instructions
sentences.chinese: 明确的指示

sentences.english: The question wasn’t very clear.
sentences.chinese: 这问题不是很清楚。

sentences.english: It’s the clearest guide I’ve used.
sentences.chinese: 我从没用过这么清晰易懂的指南。

sentences.english: Perhaps I tried to cover too much and didn’t make myself clear (= express myself well ) .
sentences.chinese: 可能是我涉及的内容太多，没有表达清楚。

sentences.english: If you don’t understand, it’s best to say so and get things clear .
sentences.chinese: 如果你不明白，那就最好照直说并把事情弄清楚。

sentences.english: If I catch you smoking again, you’re grounded. Do I make myself clear (= used when you are angry ) ?
sentences.chinese: 如果再让我发现你抽烟，我就罚你不准出门。我的话你听清楚了吗？

sentences.english: Snowplows have been out clearing the roads.
sentences.chinese: 扫雪机已经出动，去清扫路面了。

detailed_translations.english: expressed in a simple and direct way so that people understand
to make somewhere emptier or tidier by removing things from it

sentences.english: back-up copies of your files
sentences.chinese: 你的文档的备份

sentences.english: Could you copy this letter and send it out, please?
sentences.chinese: 你能把这封信复印一份发出去吗？

detailed_translations.english: something that is made to be exactly like another thing
to deliberately make or produce something that is exactly like another thing

sentences.english: It was forty five minutes before she returned.
sentences.chinese: 过了45分钟她才回来。

sentences.english: Alison decided to return home.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森决定回家。

sentences.english: He left his country, never to return.
sentences.chinese: 他离开了祖国，一去不复返。

detailed_translations.english: to go or come back to a place where you were before
the act of returning from somewhere, or your arrival back in a place
used or paid for a journey from one place to another and back again

name: anymore
trans: 与 not 连用表示 不再，再也不

sentences.english: Nick doesn’t live here anymore.
sentences.chinese: 尼克不再住在这里了。

sentences.english: She told me not to phone her anymore.
sentences.chinese: 她叫我不要再给她打电话。

detailed_translations.english: not any longer

sentences.english: The majority of union members voted in favour of a strike.
sentences.chinese: 大多数工会成员投票赞成罢工。

detailed_translations.english: a person or country that belongs to a group or organization

sentences.english: They are putting pressure on people to vote yes.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在向民众施加压力，要求他们投赞成票。

sentences.english: You must never give in to pressure .
sentences.chinese: 你绝不能屈从压力。

detailed_translations.english: an attempt to persuade someone by using influence, arguments, or threats

detailed_translations.chinese: 对…施加压力， 迫使， 说服
detailed_translations.english: to try to make someone do something by making them feel it is their duty to do it

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

sentences.english: What’s your opinion of Cathy?
sentences.chinese: 你对凯茜的看法如何？

detailed_translations.english: your ideas or beliefs about a particular subject

sentences.english: Reading and writing are two different skills.
sentences.chinese: 阅读和写作是两种不同的技能。

sentences.english: Many jobs today require computer skills.
sentences.chinese: 如今的许多工作都需要计算机技能。

detailed_translations.english: an ability to do something well, especially because you have learned and practised it

sentences.english: typical British weather
sentences.chinese: 典型的英国天气

sentences.english: This advertisement is a typical example of their marketing strategy.
sentences.chinese: 这则广告是他们营销策略的一个典型例子。

detailed_translations.english: having the usual features or qualities of a particular group or thing

sentences.english: Which football team do you support?
sentences.chinese: 你支持哪个球队？

sentences.english: kids playing football in the street
sentences.chinese: 在街上踢球的小孩子

sentences.english: My Dad took me to watch my first football match .
sentences.chinese: 爸爸带我去看了我人生第一场足球比赛。

sentences.english: a football club
sentences.chinese: 足球俱乐部

detailed_translations.english: a game played by two teams of eleven players who try to kick a round ball into the other team’s  goal

sentences.english: The cancerous cells had to be cut out.
sentences.chinese: 癌细胞必须切除。

sentences.english: Cut out the bit about racial prejudice.
sentences.chinese: 把有关种族歧视的那段删掉。

sentences.english: The current advice to pregnant women is to cut out alcohol.
sentences.chinese: 给孕妇的当前建议是戒酒。

detailed_translations.english: If you cut something out, you remove or separate it from what surrounds it using scissors or a knife.

sentences.english: That was quick! I thought you’d be another hour.
sentences.chinese: 很快啊！我以为你还要一个小时呢。

sentences.english: It’s probably quicker by train.
sentences.chinese: 乘火车可能会快一点。

sentences.english: Have we got time for a quick drink?
sentences.chinese: 我们有时间喝口东西吗？

sentences.english: What’s the quickest way to the station?
sentences.chinese: 到车站怎么走最快？

sentences.english: We stopped to have a quick look at the church.
sentences.chinese: 我们停下来迅速地扫了一眼教堂。

sentences.english: Three bombs went off in quick succession (= quickly, one after the other ).
sentences.chinese: 瞬间有三个炸弹连续爆炸。

detailed_translations.english: lasting for or taking only a short time

sentences.english: He will be continuing his education in the US.
sentences.chinese: 他将在美国继续求学。

sentences.english: 英文例句: I felt too sick to continue.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉很难受，无法继续下去了。

sentences.english: 英文例句:The road continues northwards to the border.
sentences.chinese: 中文例句: 这条路往北一直延伸到边境。

detailed_translations.english: to not stop happening, existing, or doing something

sentences.english: The report compares the different types of home computer available.
sentences.chinese: 这份报告比较了市场上不同类型的家用计算机。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比较， 对照； 把…比作
detailed_translations.english: to consider two or more things or people, in order to show how they are similar or different

sentences.english: The neighbours must think we’re crazy.
sentences.chinese: 邻居一定会认为我们疯了。

sentences.english: It’s an absolutely crazy idea .
sentences.chinese: 那绝对是个荒唐的想法。

sentences.english: I know this idea sounds crazy , but it may be worth a try.
sentences.chinese: 我知道这个主意听起来很荒唐，但也许值得一试。

sentences.english: He often works 12 hours a day – it’s crazy .
sentences.chinese: 他常常一天工作12个小时——简直疯了。

detailed_translations.english: very strange or not sensible

sentences.english: child development
sentences.chinese: 儿童发育

sentences.english: The funds will be used for marketing and product development.
sentences.chinese: 这笔资金将用于市场营销和产品开发。

detailed_translations.english: the process of gradually becoming bigger, better, stronger, or more advanced

sentences.english: It’s our job to establish the cause of the fire.
sentences.chinese: 查明起火原因是我们的责任。

sentences.english: There is no cause for alarm.
sentences.chinese: 不必惊慌。

sentences.english: My father fought for the Nationalist cause.
sentences.chinese: 我父亲为民族党的事业而奋斗。

detailed_translations.english: a person, event, or thing that makes something happen

sentences.english: Make a cheese sauce in the usual way.
sentences.chinese: 按通常的做法做奶酪酱。

sentences.english: I’ll meet you at the usual time.
sentences.chinese: 我在老时间和你碰头。

sentences.english: She ate twice as much as usual.
sentences.chinese: 她吃了平时食量两倍的东西。

detailed_translations.english: happening, done, or existing most of the time or in most situations

sentences.english: A good idea in one's opinion in my opinion in his opinion viewpoint.
sentences.chinese: 一个好主意，在一个人的意见，我认为在他看来观点。

detailed_translations.chinese: 按某人的意见；据某人看来

sentences.english: Perhaps she’s next door.
sentences.chinese: 她也许在隔壁。

sentences.english: Perhaps it will snow tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 明天可能会下雪。

sentences.english: It won’t take so long next time, perhaps.
sentences.chinese: 也许下次不用那么久。

sentences.english: ‘I don’t think you understand.’ ‘Well, perhaps not .’
sentences.chinese: “我想你不明白。”“嗯，也许吧。”

detailed_translations.english: used to say that something may be true, but you are not sure

sentences.english: The cars collided during a heavy rainstorm.
sentences.chinese: 这些车在一场暴雨中相撞了。

detailed_translations.english: a sudden heavy fall of rain

sentences.english: I forgot to set the burglar alarm.
sentences.chinese: 我忘记打开防盗警报器了。

sentences.english: Car alarms are always going off in the street.
sentences.chinese: 街上总有汽车警报器在响。

sentences.english: a sophisticated alarm system
sentences.chinese: 精密的警报系统

sentences.english: We could not see what had alarmed him.
sentences.chinese: 我们不明白是什么吓着他了。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment that makes a loud noise to warn you of danger
If something alarms you, it makes you afraid or anxious that something unpleasant or dangerous might happen

sentences.english: Then the fire alarm went off. I just grabbed my clothes and ran out.
sentences.chinese: 之后火警响了，我只抓起衣服就跑了出去。

detailed_translations.english: If an alarm bell goes off, it makes a sudden loud noise

sentences.english: As everybody’s here, let’s begin.
sentences.chinese: 大家都到齐了，我们就开始吧。

sentences.english: In the third year students begin the study of classical Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 学生在三年级开始学古代汉语。

sentences.english: The president begins talks with the prime minister tonight.
sentences.chinese: 总统将于今晚和首相展开会谈。

detailed_translations.english: to start doing something
to start doing something

sentences.english: I became heavily involved in politics.
sentences.chinese: 我深陷政治之中。

sentences.english: The report was heavily criticized in the press.
sentences.chinese: 该报道遭到了新闻界的严厉批评。

sentences.english: a heavily populated area
sentences.chinese: 人口密集地区

sentences.english: thousands of heavily armed troops
sentences.chinese: 全副武装的数千人的部队

sentences.english: His wife was heavily pregnant at the time.
sentences.chinese: 那时他妻子已经待产。

detailed_translations.english: in large amounts, to a high degree, or with great severity

sentences.english: I suddenly realized that there was someone following me.
sentences.chinese: 我突然意识到有人跟着我。

sentences.english: George died very suddenly.
sentences.chinese: 乔治死得非常突然。

sentences.english: Suddenly, the eagle opened its wings.
sentences.chinese: 突然，鹰展开翅膀。

detailed_translations.english: quickly and unexpectedly

sentences.english: She was going over to her parents' house to pick up some clean clothes for Oskar.
sentences.chinese: 她正要去父母家为奥斯卡取几件干净的衣服。

detailed_translations.english: When you pick up someone or something that is waiting to be collected, you go to the place where they are and take them away, often in a car

sentences.english: a strange city
sentences.chinese: 陌生的城市

sentences.english: strange noises
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的噪声

sentences.english: Does Geoff’s behaviour seem strange to you?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得杰夫的行为反常吗？

sentences.english: She felt there was something strange about Dexter’s voice.
sentences.chinese: 她觉得德克斯特的声音有点奇怪。

sentences.english: Isn’t it strange how animals seem to sense danger?
sentences.chinese: 动物似乎能感觉到危险，这不是很奇怪吗？

sentences.english: It’s strange that we’ve never met before.
sentences.chinese: 很奇怪，我们以前居然从来没有碰见过。

sentences.english: For some strange reason, I slept like a baby despite the noise.
sentences.chinese: 很奇怪，不知为什么，尽管很吵闹，但我仍睡得很香。

sentences.english: Strange as it may seem, I actually prefer cold weather.
sentences.chinese: 听上去也许很奇怪，我竟然喜欢冷天。

sentences.english: That’s strange. I was sure Jude was right here a second ago.
sentences.chinese: 真奇怪，我肯定祖德刚刚还在这儿的。

sentences.english: The strange thing is all four victims had red hair.
sentences.chinese: 令人奇怪的是，四名受害者都是红头发的。

detailed_translations.english: not familiar because you have not been there before or met the person before

sentences.english: The governor found himself at the center of a political storm .
sentences.chinese: 州长发现自己处于一场政治风暴的中心。

sentences.english: An angry crowd stormed the embassy.
sentences.chinese: 愤怒的人群突然袭击大使馆。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people suddenly express very strong feelings about something that someone has said or done
to suddenly attack and enter a place using a lot of force

sentences.english: The wind blew from the northeast.
sentences.chinese: 风从东北方向吹来。

detailed_translations.english: moving air, especially when it moves strongly or quickly in a current

sentences.english: You can carry this bag – it’s fairly light.
sentences.chinese: 你可以拿这个袋子——它很轻。

sentences.english: You should wear light, comfortable shoes.
sentences.chinese: 你应该穿轻便舒适的鞋子。

sentences.english: The truck was quite light and easy to drive.
sentences.chinese: 这辆卡车很轻，容易驾驶。

sentences.english: people who have suffered only light exposure to radiation
sentences.chinese: 只受到轻度辐射的人

detailed_translations.english: not very heavy

sentences.english: This is Gavin Williams, reporting from the United Nations in New York.
sentences.chinese: 我是加文·威廉斯，在纽约联合国总部为您报道。

sentences.english: We aim to report the news as fairly as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们力求公正地报道这一新闻。

sentences.english: The incident was widely reported in the national press.
sentences.chinese: 这一事件在全国的媒体上被广泛报道。

detailed_translations.english: to give people information about recent events, especially in newspapers and on television and radio

sentences.english: Only cheeses made in this area may be labelled ‘Roquefort.’
sentences.chinese: 只有这个地区出产的干酪才能被称作“罗克福尔干酪”。

sentences.english: Crime rates are much higher in urban areas.
sentences.chinese: 城镇地区的犯罪率要高很多。

sentences.english: an area of 2,000 square miles
sentences.chinese: 2,000平方英里的面积

sentences.english: The course covers three main subject areas.
sentences.chinese: 这门课程涵盖三大学科领域。

detailed_translations.english: a particular part of a country, town etc

sentences.english: Put some more wood on the fire.
sentences.chinese: 往火上再添些木柴。

sentences.english: a polished wood floor
sentences.chinese: 擦得锃亮的木地板

sentences.english: Her house was made of wood .
sentences.chinese: 她家的房子是木头盖的。

detailed_translations.english: the material that trees are made of

sentences.english: They climbed out through the window.
sentences.chinese: 他们从窗户爬出来。

sentences.english: Boost me up so I can look in the window.
sentences.chinese: 把我向上抬起，这样我能朝窗户里面看。

sentences.english: They deducted the cost of the broken window from his allowance.
sentences.chinese: 他们从他的津贴中扣除损坏窗户的费用。

detailed_translations.english: a space or an area of glass in the wall of a building or vehicle that lets in light

sentences.english: Wicky peeked at John's flashlight.
sentences.chinese: 威奇向约翰的手电筒瞥了一眼。

sentences.english: Do you have a flashlight?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有手电筒？

detailed_translations.english: a small electric light that you can carry in your hand

sentences.english: It’s our last match of the season.
sentences.chinese: 这是我们本赛季最后一场比赛。

sentences.english: They’re preparing for a big match tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 他们在为明天的一场大赛做准备。

sentences.english: McClaire’s goal earned him the title of man of the match (= the person in a team who plays best ) .
sentences.chinese: 麦克莱尔的进球为他赢得了“本场最佳球员”的称号。

sentences.english: Carlos was no match for the champion.
sentences.chinese: 卡洛斯根本不是冠军的对手。

detailed_translations.english: an organized sports event between two teams or people

sentences.english: Somebody was beating at the door.
sentences.chinese: 有人在打门。

sentences.english: Brazil were beaten 2–1.
sentences.chinese: 巴西队以1比2告负。

sentences.english: Labour easily beat the Conservatives in the last election.
sentences.chinese: 工党在上一届选举中轻松击败保守党。

detailed_translations.english: to hit sb/sth many times, usually very hard

sentences.english: There was a ladder propped up against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 有一把梯子靠在墙边。

sentences.english: sailing against the wind
sentences.chinese: 逆风航行

detailed_translations.english: next to and touching an upright surface, especially for support

sentences.english: Quiet! The baby’s asleep.
sentences.chinese: 安静！ 宝宝在睡觉。

detailed_translations.english: sleeping

sentences.english: I can not fall asleep after drinking coffee this late.
sentences.chinese: 现在这么晚了，喝咖啡之后我不能入睡。

sentences.english: And only then as I finally fall asleep do I register the blood I saw on the sock when I wiped my leg, the blood from my piss. I sleep.
sentences.chinese: 我想到了家，这个很管用，我开始昏昏欲睡，我终于注意到我擦大腿的那只袜子上的血迹，尿出来的血，却马上睡着了。

sentences.english: I said his heaven would be only half alive; and he said mine would be drunk: I said I should fall asleep in his; and he said he could not breathe in mine, and began to grow very snappish.
sentences.chinese: 我说他的天堂是半死不活的；他说我的天堂是发酒疯；我说我在他的天堂里一定要睡着的；他说他在我的天堂里就要喘不过气来，于是他开始变得非常暴躁。

sentences.english: The wind has died down quite a lot.
sentences.chinese: 风小多了。

sentences.english: The police seem unable to cope with the rising tide of (= large increase in ) car crime.
sentences.chinese: 面对日益增多的汽车罪案，警方似乎无能为力。

detailed_translations.english: to increase in number, amount, or value
an increase in number, amount, or value

sentences.english: The road was blocked by a fallen tree.
sentences.chinese: 马路被倒下的一棵树堵住了。

sentences.english: fallen leaves
sentences.chinese: 落叶

detailed_translations.english: on the ground after falling down

sentences.english: They have offices in countries as far apart as India and Peru.
sentences.chinese: 他们的办事处远至印度、秘鲁等国。

sentences.english: The police try to keep rival supporters apart at all matches.
sentences.chinese: 警方在所有的比赛中都设法将双方的支持者分开。

sentences.english: A couple of men started fighting and we had to pull them apart .
sentences.chinese: 几名男子打起架来，我们不得不将他们拉开。

sentences.english: Joel stood apart from the group, frowning.
sentences.chinese: 乔尔皱着眉头，独自站在一边。

sentences.english: Their concept of a performance and our concept were miles apart.
sentences.chinese: 他们对一场表演的概念和我们的概念相去甚远。

detailed_translations.chinese: 成距离，相间隔；分开，除去
detailed_translations.english: if things are apart, they are not close to each other or touching each other
If people or groups are a long way apart on a particular topic or issue, they have completely different views and disagree about it

sentences.english: She was greatly tempted to have a look at it.
sentences.chinese: 她非常想看一看。

sentences.english: Today we’ll have a look at a hadron collider of the Nuclear Physics Institute in Novosibirsk.
sentences.chinese: 今天让我们来看一看位于新西伯利亚市核物理研究所的强子对撞机。

sentences.english: The children really believed that there was a rabbit on the moon. They wanted to go to the moon and have a look one day.
sentences.chinese: 这个时候；一些老人会讲述许多古老的故事，如月亮上的玉兔，孩子们信以为真，他们真想有一天登上月球看个究竟。

sentences.english: an icy wind
sentences.chinese: 刺骨寒风

sentences.english: The bath water was icy cold.
sentences.chinese: 洗澡水冰冷刺骨。

sentences.english: an icy mountain road
sentences.chinese: 冰封的山路

detailed_translations.english: extremely cold

sentences.english: She’d always loved animals since she was a little kid.
sentences.chinese: 她从小就喜爱动物。

sentences.english: He’s married with three kids.
sentences.chinese: 他已婚，有三个孩子。

sentences.english: A neighbor volunteered to keep an eye on the kids (= their children or the children they are responsible for ).
sentences.chinese: 一位邻居主动来照看这些小孩。

sentences.english: college kids
sentences.chinese: 大学生

detailed_translations.english: a child

sentences.english: It took us a while to realize the extent of the tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 我们过了一段时间才意识到这场悲剧有多严重。

sentences.english: It was only later that I realized my mistake.
sentences.chinese: 我到后来才认识到自己的错误。

sentences.english: She never realized her ambition of winning an Olympic gold medal.

sentences.chinese: 留下没走的几位客人都在厨房里。

detailed_translations.english: to draw something with a crayon

sentences.english: He felt a deep sense of shame.
sentences.chinese: 他深深地感到羞愧。

sentences.english: Maria blushed with shame.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚羞得脸都红了。

sentences.english: (= it made her feel ashamed ) , she gained back all the weight she’d lost.
sentences.chinese: 让她感到惭愧的是，她减掉的体重全又长回来了。

sentences.english: He’s brought shame on the whole family.
sentences.chinese: 他使全家蒙羞。

sentences.english: (= it should not make you feel ashamed ) saying ‘I don’t know’.
sentences.chinese: 说一句"我不知道”也没什么可难为情的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羞耻，羞愧；憾事，带来耻辱的人
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you feel guilty and embarrassed because you, or someone who is close to you, have done something wrong
to make someone feel ashamed

sentences.english: He was regarded as the most successful president of modern times.
sentences.chinese: 他被看成是近代最成功的总统。

detailed_translations.english: to think about someone or something in a particular way

sentences.english: Davis was found not guilty on all counts .
sentences.chinese: 戴维斯受到指控的各项罪名均不成立。

detailed_translations.english: one of the crimes that someone is charged with

sentences.english: the story of life on a small farm at the turn of the century
sentences.chinese: 讲述世纪初一个小农场生活的故事

detailed_translations.english: one of the 100-year periods measured from before or after the year of Christ’s birth

detailed_translations.chinese: 相等的， 一致的， 依…而定的

sentences.english: I thought the medicine would make him sleep, but it had the opposite effect.
sentences.chinese: 我以为这药会让他睡觉，但是它却起了反作用。

sentences.english: At the opposite extreme, Ashworth’s style is very simple and modern.
sentences.chinese: 截然相反的是，阿什沃思的风格非常简单和现代。

sentences.english: Bob was quicker than Ed? It’s usually the opposite way round.
sentences.chinese: 鲍勃比埃德快？通常是反过来的。

detailed_translations.english: as different as possible from something else
a person or thing that is as different as possible from someone or something else

sentences.english: I never liked long walks, especially in winter.
sentences.chinese: 我向来不喜欢长距离散步，尤其在冬天。

sentences.english: Art books are expensive to produce, especially if they contain colour illustrations.
sentences.chinese: 美术类书籍制作成本很高，尤其是那些带彩色插图的。

sentences.english: I was especially fond of chocolate biscuits.
sentences.chinese: 我特别爱吃巧克力饼干。

detailed_translations.english: used to emphasize that something is more important or happens more with one particular thing than with others

sentences.english: I had a very happy childhood.
sentences.chinese: 我的童年很快乐。

detailed_translations.english: the period of time when you are a child

sentences.english: We will have to consider your offer carefully.
sentences.chinese: 我们得仔细考虑你的提议。

sentences.english: The local authority considered that the school did not meet requirements.
sentences.chinese: 当地政府认为这所学校达不到要求。

sentences.english: Have you considered my feelings?
sentences.chinese: 你考虑过我的感受吗？

detailed_translations.english: to think about something carefully, especially before making a choice or decision

sentences.english: A lot of the buildings are built very close to each other.＃
sentences.chinese: 很多建筑建造的彼此非常接近。

detailed_translations.english: almost; nearly

sentences.english: She was holding a large box.
sentences.chinese: 她提着一只大箱子。

sentences.english: I held the mouse by its tail.
sentences.chinese: 我抓着耗子的尾巴倒提起来。

sentences.english: Employees hold 30% of the shares.
sentences.chinese: 雇员持有30%的股份。

detailed_translations.english: to carry sth; to have sb/sth in your hand, arms, etc.
